utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh look, Saturn 3 is on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t want to watch Saturn 3. Deep Space Nine is better.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How is Deep Space Nine better than Saturn 3?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Simple subtraction will tell you it’s six better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Compromise. Watch Babylon 5.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In what sense is that a compromise?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, five is partway between three… Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what, how about we go rock-paper-scissors?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, I don’t think so. No, anecdotal evidence suggests that in the game of rock-paper-scissors, players familiar with each other will tie 75 to 80% of the time due to the limited number of outcomes. I suggest rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s very simple. Look, scissors cuts paper. Paper covers rock. Rock crushes lizard. Lizard poisons Spock. Spock smashes scissors. Scissors decapitates lizard. Lizard eats paper. Paper disproves Spock. Spock vaporizes rock. And as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I think I got it.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock! Oh!

utterance.speaker: Howard (entering, wearing an eye patch)
utterance.content: Hello, boys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ahoy, matey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Noticed the eye patch, did you? It’s all part of a technique I’ve been studying for picking up women. You employ a visual display designed to make yourself distinctive and memorable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh yes, like the male peacock with brilliant plumage or the rutting baboon with engorged hindquarters.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Or in this case, the bar mitzvah boy with pinkeye.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mock me if you will, but it works. You show up at a club in something distinctive, scope out your target and toss out some negs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are negs?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A neg is a negative compliment that throws a pretty woman off her game, like “Normally, I’m not turned on by big teeth, but on you, they work.” I’ve got a whole list of ’em. Who wants to be my wingman?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re not gonna need wingman, you’re gonna need a paramedic.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Howard, your scooter’s blocking my car. Aw, did you get pinkeye again?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Step one, she notices the eye patch. May I say, Penny, not a lot of women could look as hot as you do with such greasy hair?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, just move your stupid scooter before I pick it up and throw it in the dumpster.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but I’m not going to watch the Clone Wars TV series until I’ve seen the Clone Wars movie. I prefer to let George Lucas disappoint me in the order he intended.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I want to watch it now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then I believe we’ve arrived at another quintessential rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock moment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Watch whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I saw what you did there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard (answering phone)
utterance.content: Hello. Hey, Howard. What’s wrong? Okay. Okay, we’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard’s at the Mars Rover lab. He says he’s in trouble. Defcon 5.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Defcon 5? Well, there’s no need to rush.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Defcon 5 means no danger. Defcon 1 is a crisis.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How can 5 not be worse than 1?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, Star Trek V, worse than I.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, that’s a comparison of quality, not intensity. Secondly, Star Trek I is orders-of-magnitude worse than Star Trek V.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you joking? Star Trek V is the standard against which all badness is measured.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, no. Star Trek V has specific failures in writing and direction, while Star Trek I fails across the board, art direction, costuming, music, sound editing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we just forget I said Defcon and go?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Star Trek V!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, will you at least stipulate that Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home is inarguably the best?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I have three words for you. Wrath of Khan.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, thank God, you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s the emergency?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got the Mars Rover stuck in a ditch.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: On a dusty highway just outside Bakersfield. Where do you think? On Mars!

utterance.speaker: Woman (peering out of door)
utterance.content: Howard, is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, baby, I’ll be right in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You brought a girl to the Mars Rover control room?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I picked her up in the bar. She’s a doctor. One free barium enema and my mother won’t care she’s not Jewish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait a minute, so the eye patch and the insults worked?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, there were three other guys with eye patches, iIt was a fiasco. What did work was, “How’d you like to visit a secret government facility?”

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So what exactly do you want us to do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I need you and Raj to help me get the Rover out of the ditch, and I need you to get Stephanie out before somebody notices she’s here. She doesn’t exactly have clearance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? They don’t let strange women from honky-tonks come in and play with $200million government projects on distant planets?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, I was bad. Maybe she’ll spank me. Can we please move on?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Hey, Howard, you know, it’s getting late, so do I get to drive this thing or what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. No. I’m sorry, but something’s come up. Kind of a Mars Rover, Mars Rover, can Howard come over, situation. So my friend Leonard is gonna take you home.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Let’s go, friend Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll call ya.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Yeah. So are you a scientist like Howard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No one’s a scientist like Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My mother is so gonna love her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, how nice. Maybe they can carpool when they visit you in federal prison.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I totally interrupted you. What, what, what were you saying?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just said Howard’s a terrific guy. He’s got a great sense of humour, he loves his mother, a lot, some people say too much.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: I really like that you’re such a loyal friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I am loyal. You know, if you look at the big picture. Just, out of curiosity, did he ever have a shot with you?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Are you insane? The guy was wearing an eye patch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then why did you?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: He said that I could drive a car on Mars.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it. So, can I see you again?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: You’re not gonna see me now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ooh. Cool.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I was just checking my e-mail. But, uh, no, the Rover is not responding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe the appropriate metaphor here involves a river of excrement and a Native American water vessel without any means of propulsion.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on, there’s got to be other options.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You could try calling Triple-A, but based on NASA’s latest timetable, they won’t get there for 35 years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Plus I understand you have to be standing next to the vehicle with your card when they arrive.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, snap.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Snap what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: OK, I guess we have to turn to Plan B.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s Plan B?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Erase all the hard drives, scrap the surveillance tapes, wipe our fingerprints off every surface and run.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why wasn’t that Plan A?

utterance.speaker: Voice from television
utterance.content: REPORTER: A NASA spokesman states that due to the loss of data, they will most likely be unable to determine the cause of the Mars Rover’s malfunction. This is not the first time an exploratory mission to Mars has ended in disappointment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank God for Plan B.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Howard, didn’t you say you worked on the Mars Rover?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, you’re mistaken.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, when we first met, you said that if I went out with you, I could drive a car on Mars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Psst! Psst!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will you all excuse me? Leonard is subtly signalling that he’d like to talk to me in private.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Yeah, I remember specifically. You started by asking if I was from Mars because my ass was out of this world.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, that does sound like me, but no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is there some problem?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen, I have to kinda sneak out for a while.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, wait! If anyone asks you where I went, you don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t tell you that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who would ask me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t tell you that, either.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So you brought me in here to inform me that you can’t tell me where you’re going and you can’t tell me who might ask?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I really didn’t think this through.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, a moment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If someone, and of course, we don’t know who this would be, does ask where you’ve gone, what should I say?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Just tell them I went to the office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you going to the office?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then how can I say it convincingly?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just say, Leonard went to the office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Leonard went to the office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is? No, not like that! Just, Leonard went to the office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This would have worked out a lot better if you’d just told me you were going the office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to the office.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See? Why don’t I believe you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going out for a while.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Doesn’t anyone want to know where he’s going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, where is he going?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard is going to the office.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So how was work today?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Busy. I removed an appendix, a gall bladder and about a foot and a half of bowel.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m hoping that’s three different guys.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: No, just the one. He didn’t make it. So, how was your day?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, you know, I’m a physicist, so, I thought about stuff.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: That’s it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, I wrote some of it down.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Are you done eating?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Oh, good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If I knew you were waiting, I would’ve swallowed that lasagna whole.

utterance.speaker: Phone rings. Answering machine
utterance.content: You’ve reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Hey, Steph, it’s me again, Howard. Listen, if you’re free Friday, maybe we could have a little something to eat at my place. My mom cooks a hell of a brisket. Let me know. It’s Howard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve had her brisket. Melts in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Maybe we should think about going to the bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s a good idea. There’s a bed in there, and I’m very, very, very pro-bed.

utterance.speaker: Phone rings. Answering machine
utterance.content: You’ve reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Hey, it’s me again. Just want to let you know the head count for dinner Friday has gone up. My Aunt Betty and Uncle Elliot are coming in from Palm Springs. Oh, and if anybody should ask, you’re half-Jewish on your mother’s side. Okay, call me. It’s Howard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t you think we should tell him you’re not interested?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Do you want me to stop and call him back right now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Dear God, no!

utterance.speaker: Steph (from bedroom door)
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard…

utterance.speaker: Phone rings. Answering machine
utterance.content: You’ve reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message. Beep.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Hey, it’s me again. Howard. Listen, my cousins from Fort Lauderdale are flying in to meet you so that means we’re gonna have to move the dinner to a restaurant.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Tell her we’re going to the Olive Garden! I have a coupon from the paper.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: We’re not going to the Olive Garden, Mom!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Oh, Mr. Bigshot with his Red Lobster.

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: I’ll call you back when we firm up the details. It’s Howard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: New shirts?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, a couple.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, who’s the girl?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, last time you bought a new shirt was when we were dating.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, uh, what we did was in fact dating?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, yeah, we did have a date.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly. Thank you. Do me a favour, tell Koothrappali that next time you see him.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, who is she?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, she’s a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, nice. A doctor doctor, or a you kind of doctor?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Doctor doctor. Surgical resident. Smart, pretty. Let me ask you something. If your friend thinks he’s dating someone, but he’s not because, in fact, you’re dating her, does that make you a bad person?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, that depends.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: On what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is that friend Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Screw him. You’re fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, have you slept with her yet? You dog! Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does that change things?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So why’d you ask?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m nosy. See ya.

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Howard, get the door!

utterance.speaker: Howard (voice)
utterance.content: Really? Is that what you do when someone knocks? Thank you. I had no idea! Hey, buddy. What brings you to my little slice of hell?

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: Who is it?!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s Leonard!

utterance.speaker: Howard’s Mother (voice)
utterance.content: You’re gonna have to play outside! I’m not dressed to receive!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No one cares, Ma! So, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, I need to talk to you about something.

utterance.speaker: Howard (his phone rings)
utterance.content: Momentito. Yello. Oh, Stephanie, thanks for calling me back. I was worried… Oh… Uh-huh… Uh-huh… Uh-huh… No, I understand… Sure, we can be friends. Absolutely. Thanks for calling. Yeah, you have a nice day, too. You are dead to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, who gets the extra dumpling?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, one of us is going to have to stop putting up Spock.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How do we decide that?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hi, Howard. Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard is employing a schoolyard paradigm in which you are, for all intents and purposes, deceased. He intends to act on this by not speaking to you, feigning an inability to hear you when you speak and otherwise refusing to acknowledge your existence.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s just ridiculous. Why are you cooperating with him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t make the rules, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, come on, I didn’t plan on this. These things just happen. Usually not to me, but they do happen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did someone just feel a cold breeze?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe this is an extension of the death metaphor. The cold breeze is the so-called ectoplasmic issue of a disembodied soul passing by.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, screw it, I’m just gonna eat the dumpling.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (answering door)
utterance.content: Oh, hi, Steph, come on in.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Is this a bad time?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but I don’t see a better one on the horizon, so…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, if it isn’t Mrs. Dead to Me.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Hello, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look I’m sorry, you violated the terms of your metaphor by acknowledging her existence. I’m out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He just won’t listen to me.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Okay, I guess it’ll just be the three of us then.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hmm. Lisa’s gonna be disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Lisa?

utterance.speaker: Steph
utterance.content: Yeah, my roommate. She just went through a really bad breakup and I thought she might like to meet somebody fun like you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, Stephanie, you’re alive, it’s a miracle!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, anyway, Lisa, I just wanted to tell you again how much I enjoyed the other night, and again, I’m sorry for how it ended. But again, if you could let me know about Friday. My mother needs a head count so she can know how big a brisket to get.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, Howard, look at this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyway, call me. It’s Howard.

utterance.speaker: Voice from TV
utterance.content: The possibility of life on Mars has long fascinated scientists and laypersons alike. It’s unclear how the Mars Rover got into the crevice, but one thing’s certain, the data which it has sent back contain the first clear indications that there may have been life on Mars. It’s a scientific discovery that has staggering implications for all mankind. Unfortunately, we’ll never know who’s responsible.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Son of a bitch.
